reviews.review_msg: It was the worst prof I have ever had. He went out of his way to be rude to students. He belived students didn't have any courses or a life outside of his course and that was his entire personality. He even refused to give me a day of when someone from my immediate family unexpectedly passed away. Beware!

POL 452W specifically is more of an economics course than anything else. This course is with graduate students too so you will be held to the same expectations as them, which is unfair. Anil himself doesn't give clear instructions so you're figuring everything out by yourself. He teaches quickly and expects you to retain the information quickly.
good professor with interesting content in this class, good bsci course if not strong at math/science

I took this course years ago with Prof Hira but still think of it often. I took several courses with him over the years and he positively impacted my experience in the university and the program. His classes aren't easy but if you are looking to have a really fulsome understanding of the topic and be challenged I really recommend any Hira course.

This is a class of discussions and not much learning in the traditional sense. There is no textbook, just weekly readings. The topics are relevant to the class and he fosters a good discussion environment in class. Asks for 2 essays over the semester and will provide good feedback on your proposals. Good class for science and engineering students.

The best prof I've ever had who shifted my entire trajectory in my undergraduate career. Because of Dr. Hira, I rethought my education, and translated it into practical, tangible and realistic tools that got me my Master's degree afterwards, and a very successful career as an Arts graduate. His focus on policy is a pure refreshment in poli sci.

Andy was a great professor, I took classes with him many years ago and I have been very successful in my career. He gave me very good advice and encouragement. He sees beyond the confines of rhetoric and can point you where you need to go. He is the best professor I had at SFU. He was a catalyst in my education and career, very grateful!

Dr. Hira is a hard working and the only "FULL-TIME" prof in the faculty. He helps students and provides excellent feedback for improvements. Therefore, you are expected to work in a different standard. On the other hand, he is a tough grader, he assumes that student take only his course, and other life activities are "Certeris Paribus". Tough prof.

Andy definitely makes you put in the work for this class, but the outcome is very rewarding. He is passionate about what he teaches and is always available for extra help. Very thorough with instruction and cares about his students.
The Political Science department has multiple pages of complaints regarding Anil Hira.
If a student gets a C or C+ from Anil, then they did good.
I'm so glad my Poli Sci friends and Professors warned me to stay away from him. He fails people and marks hard like he has something to prove.

One of the most accessible and informative professors you'll find. Not an easy A but you can get a great grade if you're willing to work. I would just be careful not to to take too many intensive classes alongside one of Dr. Hira's upper division classes.
tough grade and hard exam get ready to read 20-30 pages each week

Pol 150 was definitely an interesting class! If you put time and effort into the weekly readings, and keep up to date on lectures, you'll be fine! In saying that, readings are defiantly heavy.. and theres a lot of them. At one point we had 200 pages per week. Two large papers make up your grade in the course, so take time on it!
The reading was a little heavy, but you learn so much! He is a great prof and makes classes really interactive and engaging.

One of the best. He is very tough but his course will definitely improve your writing ability and critical thinking. Very caring though his outward behaviour might sometimes be abrupt-- prob because he's very busy. Even if you struggling, if you show him you are trying he does his best for you. Gives the best readings for the field he is teaching.

Slackers beware, he will grill you hard for failing to study every week. Otherwise, he is honestly one of the best professors I've had the pleasure of taking a class with at SFU and really cares about the success of his students. I would recommend him to anyone looking to not only get a diploma, but an education too.

Andy is one of the quality professors at SFU.  Definitely a course you will learn in but be prepared to work hard.  His class is not for slackers and there is lots of discussion.  He is also very flexible with his course and may make it a bit easier if you ask. Has some subtle jokes that are quite funny and his party at the end of semester was fun
Dr. Hira is a very helpful and informative professor. He has a high expectation on students' performance, but he is very organized and informative on the subjects that he teachs..

I failed his first class for POL451. Why? cause I slacked. I took his other class POL 452W it was just awesome. Be prepared to work hard but if you do he really does remember you and goes beyond to help you out! He also has a party at his house at the end of the semester :)
I had classes with Andy 10 years ago when i went to SFU. Best prof i had at that crummy 2nd rate school. He makes you think and is a great mentor. Wish all my teachers had been as great.
He is a very disciplined scholar and a demanding teacher. He makes students think beyond the textbook. I would recommend this class to everybody as it made take more of pol. sc. classes.

You either love him or you hate him.  There is no inbetween.  Be prepared to work hard.  Slackers will fail.  As long as you put in the work every day, he will make it worth your while.  Extremely helpful when you go see him in his office.  He has a very understated sense of humor.  I would recommend him personally.

Anil Hira is a fantastic professor. He expects a lot from each student, but only because he puts in so much work, himself. View his website: http://www.sfu.ca/~ahira     to see for yourself. My only regret is that I took this course in my first term ever. I was completely unprepared to work to a level I would be happy with. Interesting class.

He is very demanding of all students and often calls on random people during class. He takes attendance every lecture and this course requires a lot of reading and analytical thinking. Also, for a 3 credit course, he required 2 essays, 2 midterms and a final. Also focused on a lot of history rather than current events. Be prepared to work.

Andy is the greatest Prof I have ever had. He is tough but very fair and helpful. I like that he makes an effort to scare the crap out of the slackers. If you can't take the heat and don't want to work, drop out.
DONT EVER TAKE HIS CLASSS...he is BORING!!!!

Awesome Prof, makes you write your papers where you have to think and actually apply your own knowledge.  His grading is fair. Gives lots of feedback on your papers and also what he expects.  For those that complain about the grading percents go to a University in the States that is like how they all are.

Excellent professor; one of the few whose sole purpose in teaching is to ensure that students have tangible and identifiable skills needed to secure employment after graduation.  Very pragmatic approach to teaching and helping students to prepare for future careers.

be prepared to stay on top of the required work, if you do this you will do well. Andy is one of the most helpful and caring profs at SFU as long as you are committed to the course. if you want to slack off, move on...also, if you are looking for a prof who can truly prepare you for the real world, this is your man! he is very generous on grading.

I was very intimidated because of the comments on here.  He surprised me as one of the warmest caring professors at SFU.  You put in the effort and I guarantee you will be rewarded a million times over.  One of the best academic experiences for me at SFU.  Can't wait to enroll in his next class.
This prof is rigid. Not a likeable person and very narrowminded. Forgets the point is for students to learn.

This class is demanding, even for graduate school. He is demanding of his students, but also demanding of himself. Take a class with Andy only if you REALLY want to learn and work hard for it. And be prepared to talk in class. Slackers beware!

Too much info explored in this class. Too spread out. needs a new style too boring to listen to in lectures. hard to learn when its a straight 3 hour lecture. more interaction needed other than just tutorial interaction.

Yeah, he's a demanding professor as far as professors go, but he is really committed to teaching. He makes time to help you with anything whenever he can and he seems genuinely interested in what students have to say. He is far from condescending and humble about his own knowledge and experience.

This is his grading scale! What a nut. If his profs gave grades like this he wouldn't be a Phd. Avoid at all costs.                                                           A+ 97-100
 A 94-96
 A- 90-93
 B+ 87-89
 B 84-86
 B- 80-83
 C+ 77-79
 C 74-76
 C- 70-73
extremely demanding professor. that said, you will learn so much about latin america if you take a course with him.

Hira is demanding but fair, and always available. Slackers beware: don't take his class if you cannot commit the time. But your reward at the semester's end is a strong knowledge of the subject and better-honed analytic ability.

Shame on all of you slackers who insult Dr. Hira. Always willing to help. Yeah sure there is a lot of work in his class, but at the end of the semester you improve 200% in writing and analytical skills. If you are a lazy bum you will get smoked; and it appears that most of the people who made comments are.
He's so hard & demanding. Never wanna take his class again!
No Comments

This class was difficult but his door was always open for help. He wasn't always clear but it just takes a quick visit for clarity. It seemed as though the class chose to pick on him even though he was open to suggestions.
No Comments

WORST CLASS EVER. He terrified me. Ridiclues you if you don't know the anwser. Expects way too much from his students. Hardest marker ever. 82 %is a C ! When you get back your essays you have to try not to cry because of all the mean things he writes...not constructive criticism at all!!!
No Comments

Dr. Hira is very demanding, but also very helpful.  (I've never had an assignment returned to me that had so many comments and suggestions for improvement.)  If you want an easy class, he's not for you, but if you want to actually learn something and be challenged, then there's no one better.
he's way too hard~~ a smart prof tho...but way way way too hard. hard to please him no matter how hard u try!
One of the best courses I took at U.  Emphasis on discussion/critical thinking. Teacher with actual government experience. Real world emphasis could intimidate some egghead academics.

The first couple of weeks I was very scared in class. He demands a lot, but you also learn a lot. I would not recommend him for simple minded left wing individuals, but if you are realistic then he is highly recommended
He's intimidating, but very flexible with the assignments and also very helpful. Don't answer his questions in class unless you have the knowledge of a walking library.
He is one of the most dedicated professors I have ever worked with.
you can't please him no matter how hard you try
Only the lefties seem to hate this guy. He is a gr8 teacher.Don't hand in late!
He's too strict and tends to ridicule those who don't know the answer.
this guy is impossible to get along with - he's way too hard.
IR made easy, make you think in solutions...beautiful eyes
A must professor for anyone in IR who wants to go to grad school.
No Comments
Amazing prof! First time I have ever been challenged to think and analyse at SFU
